response.answer_text: Great question, but we should ask whether one can think without a brain. A soul cannot think, they follow the instincts and patterns learned from a physical life. We incarnate to challenge old instincts, and to assess new belief systems. In the end advanced souls follow the stream of chi that is purely divine, unconditional love and this becomes the instinct and wisdom. In this state, an enlightened spirit can listen and flow with divine awareness, never needing after this point to think without guidance, but become guidance. Angels do not think, they are extensions to divine essence, they follow divine law without question, and they can hear requests and act according to the principles of divine law. No thought. Humans being so primitive have yet to comprehend a state of being when all is known, all options assessed, and results embraced in a single moment, though some psychics can not only advise, see the possible futures and advise on a preferred course of actions. And so we incarnate with a brain until we can feel the way without it, then we cease our incarnations.

Science hasn't been able to explain how living, sentient beings like humans think. What is a thought? How does a brain that is proven to follow all known laws of physics generate something like thoughts that do not have a physical existence? These are the questions that scientists are still grappling with. In fact, consciousness, which is nothing but a stream of thoughts, is one of the hard problems that scientists and philosophers have been fruitlessly pondering for centuries. With such being the case for us humans who have a physical body, I don't think a soul, which is mostly a metaphysical concept rather than a physical reality, has any luck. So, if you ask science “Can souls think?”, the answer would be “It's undefined since the subject of your interest, the soul, is undefined or unprovable”. PS: I'm sorry if you were looking for a religious answer. Since I saw the question was tagged under spirituality, which doesn't preclude scientific enquiry, I've given an answer from a scientific standpoint.

Besides the fact that no one can provide proof for their opinion on the matter, the question couldn’t really be answered without first defining what you think soul is… because frankly, different cultures use the word soul to refer to different things. From my own perspective, which is a nondual perspective influenced by eastern philosophy, soul has nothing to do with any discrete characteristics, let alone thought. In the nondual view, soul is equated with existence or being, which is a very generalized principle. However, that generalized principle serves as a basis for particularized minds… and minds do think. Likewise, one could ask if the body thinks, and the answer would be that the body as a general entity does not think, but as the substratum in which a brain exists, it provides the necessary condition for thought to occur.
